file.name: Z:/Documents/Flash/FizzBuzzTest/src/Main.as
file.violation: Constructor must be as lightweight as possible. No control statement allowed, whereas a cyclomatic complexe of 2 has been detected. The Just-In-Time compiler does not compile constructors. Make them as lightweight as possible, or move the complexity of the code to a method called by the constructor. Then the complexity will be compiled by the JIT
A constructor should not have a return type. Even if this is syntactically correct, there should not be a return type for a constructor
